title: fix: restore apps page by fetching APPS.md from GitHub
author: voodoohop

gist.headline: The garden is open again
gist.blurb: Oops! The apps page took a brief nap. We've reconnected the plumbing, and the community showcase is blooming once more.
gist.summary: Fixed a regression in the apps page data fetching logic that caused the directory to appear empty.
gist.impact: Visitors can once again browse and discover all community-built applications on the platform.
gist.visual_concept: The concept is restoration and visibility. The apps were missing (invisible), now they are found (visible). A garden metaphor works best for Pollinations. The bee is tending to a garden that has suddenly sprung back to life.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the cute bee mascot opening a rustic wooden gate to reveal a vibrant, blooming digital garden. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and peach pastel gradient background. Chunky retro sprites of colorful pixel flowers and tiny app icons growing on vines. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Text in pixel font: 'APPS RESTORED'. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
